body:
i think that my problem is connected. it started after last commits (week or so) and i`ve noticed that i`m uploading files and everything is ok but after re-login i see that my encryption key has changed and i need to put my password. but i don`t changed my password.

when i click on encrypted file i see:

your private key is not valid! likely your password was changed outside the owncloud system (e.g. your corporate directory). you can update your private key password in your personal settings to recover access to your encrypted files.
@ser72 i just tried it but can't reproduce it. can you please check your apache error log and owncloud.log for further information?

@ser72 @schiesbn today i`ve updated to lastest stable5 (the only file was changed was lib/base.php) - i don`t know if it is connected but now i see again:

your private key password no longer match your log-in password:
set your old private key password to your current log-in password. if you don't remember your old password you can ask your administrator to recover your files. 

![owncloud_key](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1582475/1065769/579315aa-139e-11e3-90d5-3e899cdb5d5d.png)

i did not changed my password. i can fill now old and current password (both are the same since i didn`t change them) and it will work for some time and they i will see that again. why this is happening to me? :)

update: i`ve just turned on debug, logged out from owncloud and login again and this message disappeared.
@schiesbn i am the admin, noone else and i didn`t change anything.

seems to be solved. something similar could also happen if the "remember" checkbox is checked during login, see issue https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/4462 a fix is on the way: https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/4967
